results.title: E.R. Doctors Misdiagnose Patients With Unusual Symptoms
results.abstract: Doctors fail to recognize serious conditions like stroke and sepsis in tens of thousands of patients each year, according to a new study.
org_facet: Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality

media.caption: While these errors remain relatively rare in the emergency room, they are most likely to occur when someone presents with symptoms that are not classic signs of a condition.
media.copyright: Adria Malcolm for The New York Times

results.byline: By Michael C. Bender and Maggie Haberman
results.title: Trump Sells a New Image as the Hero of $99 Trading Cards
results.abstract: Money from sales of the digital trading cards, which depict the former president as characters like a superhero and a “Top Gun”-style fighter pilot, will go directly to him instead of his 2024 campaign.

media.caption: A photo illustration showing former President Donald J. Trump’s newly released digital trading card collection. Incentives to buy the $99 cards include entry into a series of sweepstakes to meet Mr. Trump or golf at one of his properties.

results.title: ‘Nightmare’ Warehouse Fire Erases Evidence in Many Unsolved Cases
results.abstract: Lawyers say evidence in cold cases and bids for exoneration disappeared or was ruined when a Police Department storage facility in Brooklyn went up in flames.

results.title: Sheriff Found Not Guilty of Falsely Accusing Black Newspaper Carrier
results.abstract: Ed Troyer, the sheriff of Pierce County, Wash., was charged in 2021 with making a false claim after saying that the carrier had threatened to kill him. A jury acquitted him on Wednesday.

media.caption: Sheriff Ed Troyer of Pierce County, Wash., told a 911 dispatcher in January 2021 that he had used his S.U.V. to corner a man who was driving “in and out of driveways” in his neighborhood in Tacoma.

results.title: Billie Moore, Coach of Champions in Women’s Basketball, Dies at 79
results.abstract: She was the first coach to lead two different schools to titles in the 1970s, when the women’s college game was new and struggling.

media.caption: Billie Moore in 1991, when she was head coach of U.C.L.A.’s women’s basketball team, which she led to a collegiate championship in the 1977-78 season. She earlier coached California State University, Fullerton, to the title.
